src:
Hari Ini IHSG Ditutup Melemah Dipicu Kontraksi Data Manufaktur
01 Nov 2019, 12:11 by Antara, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Indeks harga saham gabungan (IHSG) Bursa Efek Indonesia (BEI) pada Jumat, 1 November 2019, ditutup melemah dipicu kontraksi data manufaktur domestik.
IHSG ditutup melemah 21,13 poin atau 0,34 persen ke posisi 6.207,19. Sementara kelompok 45 saham unggulan atau indeks LQ45 bergerak turun 4,76 poin atau 0,48 persen menjadi 980,09.
"Faktor utama pelemahan indeks ialah bahwasanmya market telah mengetahui bahwa data Market Manufacturing PMI Indonesia per Oktober yang mengalami penurunan di angka 47,7 dari 49,1, menandakan bahwa sektor manufaktur di tanah air semakin mengalami kontraksi. Sedangkan untuk data inflasi domestik masih menunjukkan tren yang stabil," kata analis Binaartha Sekuritas M Nafan Aji Gusta di Jakarta, Jumat.
Dibuka melemah, IHSG menghabiskan waktu sepanjang hari di zona merah hingga penutupan bursa saham.
Penutupan IHSG sendiri diiringi aksi jual saham oleh investor asing yang ditunjukkan dengan jumlah jual asing bersih atau "net foreign sell" sebesar Rp 215,87 miliar.
Frekuensi perdagangan saham tercatat sebanyak 580.645 kali transaksi dengan jumlah saham yang diperdagangkan sebanyak 18,81 miliar lembar saham senilai Rp9,14 triliun. Sebanyak 135 saham naik, 299 saham menurun, dan 128 saham tidak bergerak nilainya.
Sementara itu, bursa saham regional Asia antara lain indeks Nikkei melemah 76,2 poin atau 0,33 persen ke 22.850,8, indeks Hang Seng menguat 194,1 poin atau 0,72 persen ke 27.100,8, dan indeks Straits Times melemah 0,45 poin atau 0,01 persen ke posisi 3.229,43.

ANTARA
text:
Today JCI closed Weakening Triggered by Contraction in Manufacturing Data
01 Nov 2019, 12:11 by Antara, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) composite stock price index (IDX) on Friday, November 1, 2019, closed lower on the back of a contraction in domestic manufacturing data.
JCI closed down 21.13 points or 0.34 percent to 6,207.19. While the group of 45 leading stocks or LQ45 index moved down 4.76 points or 0.48 percent to 980.09.
"The main factor weakening the index is that the market has learned that the Indonesian PMI Market Manufacturing data per October which declined at 47.7 from 49.1, indicates that the manufacturing sector in the country is experiencing a contraction. While for domestic inflation data still shows a trend stable, "Binaartha Sekuritas M analyst Nafan Aji Gusta said in Jakarta on Friday.
Opened lower, JCI spent all day in the red zone until the closing of the stock market.
The closing of the Jakarta Composite Index itself was accompanied by a stock sell-off by foreign investors as indicated by the number of net foreign selling or "net foreign sell" of Rp 215.87 billion.
The frequency of shares trading was recorded at 580,645 times transactions with the number of shares traded at 18.81 billion shares valued at Rp9.14 trillion. As many as 135 shares rose, 299 shares declined, and 128 shares did not move in value.
Meanwhile, Asian regional stock exchanges included the Nikkei index down 76.2 points or 0.33 percent to 22,850.8, the Hang Seng index rising 194.1 points or 0.72 percent to 27,100.8, and the Straits Times index down 0 , 45 points or 0.01 percent to 3222.43 positions.

AMONG
